Commentary: nudges it off his pads to midwicket to get the score ticking
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length, angling the ball across the right-hander, Liton blocks
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, no run

Commentary: drifts down the leg side, easy call for umpire Palliyaguruge
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 wide

Commentary: glides it down to third man, off the back foot
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run

Commentary: flicks it off his hips to deep square leg. Looks like Unadkat is pretty happy banging the new ball into the pitch.
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: works the back of a length ball around his front pad to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run

Commentary: stamp the Tamim trademark on that, and then send it back please! Shifts inside the line of the short ball from over the wicket and flick-pulls it, with his front leg up in the air, with grrrreeeeat style
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

Commentary: loops it up outside off, Liton taps it down to long-on
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Liton Das, 1 run

Commentary: a little bit of drift into the left-hander, and that's enough to catch Tamim playing outside the line.
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: appeal for lbw, but it comes only from the close-in fielders. Washington doesn't even bother, because he knows the good length ball hitting Tamim as he defends would be sliding down with the angle from around the wicket, it
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: shifts his weight back to pull the flatter delivery to the right of deep midwicket. Good hustle from Rahul to stop the boundary
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

Commentary: pushes it through full on leg stump, Tamim works it to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: a perfectly straight ball - pitched up, but not far enough to be a half-volley - forces a tame, almost defeated block. Liton had lunged forward with such happy thoughts, only to be foiled
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Liton Das, no run

Commentary: on the pads again and Tamim whips it away to deep square leg. The ball seems to take ages to get there, and Pandey chasing it down has to put in a big dive
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, 3 runs

Commentary: races down the pitch and slashes the length ball over point. Unadkat tries his best to keep it wide of Liton's reach, to perhaps try and one-up him. But to little avail
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, SIX runs

Commentary: drills a full-length delivery down to mid-off
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run

Commentary: taps a back of a good length ball into the midwicket region
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: walks across his stumps, draws the bowler's fire, and then gently lifts the ball over square leg
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Liton Das, 1 run

Commentary: flicks a good length ball on off stump through to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: drifts into leg stump, Tamim glances it fine, but there's a man there for the shot
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

Commentary: top edge and it's taken! Beautiful work from Washington! All he does is plant the ball on a length, a shade outside off. Liton therefore thinks he has the room to free his arms and goes for the slog sweep. But the trick here is the slowness of pace. And the preciseness of length. It pitches just before the bat swings, and then bounces over the middle to take the edge. Lovely stuff.
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Liton Das, OUT
Dismissal_text: Liton Das c Raina b Washington Sundar 11 (9b 0x4 1x6) SR: 122.22

Commentary: brings out the reverse sweep, but the lack of pace from the bowler means the ball barely goes off the square
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: the straighter one and it beats Sabbir all ends up. He's stuck in the crease, not sure how it will spin, and when it does hold its line, he goes searching for it.
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: increases his pace now, the line on middle stump, cramping Sabbir as he flicks ti midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: gets forward to block and once again Washington has wrapped up two overs with virtually no runs.. oh, and a wicket.
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: slog sweep, which is a decent option to a flat delivery on leg stump. But India have protection at square leg
Commentary_short: Chahal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

Commentary: what a caaaaatch! Shardul Thakur is the man, standing on the very edge of the long-on boundary. The ball is still set to lob over him for six... that is until he leaps up and sticks out a hand and comes down with that little white thing in his clutches! But he's about to overbalance! There's one.. two.. three little skips... with his hands spread out to keep himself within the ropes... and he pulls it off! India's spinners are ruling in Colombo and Tamim's efforts to dominate them sends him back. He tries a brazen loft, coming down the track to instill momentum into his shot. But Chahal, with that uncanny ability to know when a batsman will attack him, shifts his line wider to ensure a mis-hit
Commentary_short: Chahal to Tamim Iqbal, OUT
Dismissal_text: Tamim Iqbal c Thakur b Chahal 15 (13b 1x4 0x6) SR: 115.38

Commentary: pushes it past the bowler's left
Commentary_short: Chahal to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

Commentary: indulges in a slog sweep - and though the ball is pretty full - Sabbir is able to get under it and those strong forearms provide all the power needed to slam it to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: another sweep, but this time the quick, back of a length ball, leaps off the top of the pad and wanders away to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 leg bye

Commentary: sweeps straight to square leg! Attacking batting... at it's worst? Sarkar is new to the crease. Chahal is one of India's match-winners. And he takes a length ball on middle and gift wraps it for Dhawan to collect
Commentary_short: Chahal to Soumya Sarkar, OUT
Dismissal_text: Soumya Sarkar c Dhawan b Chahal 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50.00

Commentary: runs down the pitch and swipes across the line to deep square leg
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: half an appeal for lbw as Mushfiqur nudges a length ball off his pads to midwicket. Would be sliding down.
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 leg bye

Commentary: shortish on off stump, clips it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: pull... shot... top edge... over the keeper! And immediately Mushfiqur is down the pitch to talk to the batsman, pointing at the vacant square leg region as he completes an animated conversation. Seems like he's telling the big-hitter to calm down
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: hacks the back of a length ball to midwicket
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: full and wide outside off - a little too wide
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 wide

Commentary: goes full and straight, Sabbir walks across to flick, and the ball deflects off the pad and wanders to the wicketkeeper. Shardul wants to check on lbw - the umpire rules against it - and he wants a review. Doesn't get any support from Karthik and the same with Rohit
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: presses forward to block towards point and secures the single
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: reverts to the reverse, but again, he finds backward point. Unadkat moves to his left and stops runs
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: a shade short and wide and Sabbir slaps it to deep point
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: yanks a very full delivery outside off out to deep midwicket with a well executed sweep shot. Head over the ball, wrists rolling as he plays it to keep the ball down
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: short-arm pulls it to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: pushes it through, but Mushfiqur is waiting for it, camped on the back foot for a little late cut. Plays it softly enough to pinch the single.
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: whirls his wrists over the full delivery outside off and sends it to long-on
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: heaves it over the square leg boundary and that brings up Bangladesh's fifty. Good shot selection from Sabbir. Shankar is not really a specialist bowler. He's medium pace. So he hares down the track and slogs him to oblivion
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX runs

Commentary: knows the bowler will correct his length and bowl fuller and he's waiting with the scoop! Brilliant cricket! Pre-empted the bowler. Put pressure on him. And reaped all the rewards
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: jabs the full delivery down to mid-off and sprints through to the other end. Sabbir could not have played the last three balls better
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: shimmies down again to slog a short delivery out to deep midwicket.
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: rolls out the legspinner, which Sabbir dabs to short third man. The throw comes in from Dhawan, it deflects off the stumps into no-man's land, eventually allowing a single
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: nice and slow and tossed up wide. Sabbir eases forward and slices the ball through cover
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: drifts down leg and it needs a top save from Vijay Shankar at short fine leg from becoming a boundary. Mushfiqur's sweep shot is a thing of beauty. Plays it anywhere between fine leg and long-on
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: quick and short outside off, he cuts to point
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: tries to pull a pretty full delivery - and a quick one at that - and is hit on the pad before he even brings his bat down properly
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: sweeps the tossed up (possible) googly outside off to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: pushes it through flat on off stump. Mushfiqur keeps leg side of it, hoping it would turn. It doesn't. So he has to quickly spear it through the covers
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: pulls his length back, and makes sure not to give too much room. And as a result, Mushfiqur, coming down the track, has to settle for a single through the covers
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: slogs a full toss out to deep square leg. Would ya look at that, even his bad balls don't go
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs

Commentary: premeditates a reverse sweep and Washington immediately takes all the pace off the ball. So much that Sabbir is standing there, waiting for it to arrive and when it does, he can barely hit it off the square at point
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: slices it to cover
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

Commentary: comes down the pitch and flicks it to long-on
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

Commentary: tries to advance again, but Washington one-ups him with a yorker, right at his feet. Three overs done, only ten runs given
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: miscues the slice and it's taken! Beautiful bowling from Chahal, but it's fast becoming his signature now. The loopy, wide delivery - this time it's the googly - that confounds a batsman looking to tear him apart. Mushfiqur is reaching away from his body. He plays the on-the-up slash, gets a top edge, and Shankar, running to his right tracks it down and takes it with a good dive.
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, OUT
Dismissal_text: Mushfiqur Rahim c Shankar b Chahal 9 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75.00

Commentary: pulls the shortish delivery on off stump away to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: doesn't read the googly and the front-foot block produces an inside edge, which scurries away to long leg
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: sweeps a very full, very wide delivery out to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Chahal to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: hangs back, but is put in trouble by the length of the ball being pretty full. Plonks his bat down on it hurriedly and it doesn't go any further than the side of the pitch
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: slices the back of a length delivery out to the sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Chahal to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: comes down the track and heaves a back of a length ball between deep midwicket and long-on
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs

Commentary: good work from Raina on the long-on boundary, racing to his right, putting in the big dive and stopping a certain boundary. Mahmudullah is Bangladesh's finisher and he's proving that with some lusty blows over the leg side
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs

Commentary: shortish delivery slithers down the leg side as Mahmudullah looks to glance it away
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 wide

Commentary: back of the hand slower ball, which he picks and deftly flicks through to long-on
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 2 runs

Commentary: turns a full ball down to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: steps out and launches a slower delivery on leg stump to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: top work on the deep square leg boundary, with Manish countering the ball hitting the turf and spinning away from him. Suddenly he finds himself to the right of the ball and has to stick his hands out to collect a fiercely-hit pull shot from reaching the boundary
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length from around the wicket, slices it to deep third man
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: works the back of a length delivery to short fine leg
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: slower ball on middle, Mahmudullah attempts to nudge it into the leg side, but can't
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: there we go! Third man is up. The ball is short. Mahmudullah knows all he has to do is push it into the gap and does it brilliantly. What a late cut
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mahmudullah, FOUR runs

Commentary: run-out chance! Unadkat races to his right to stop Mahmudullah's attempt at a quick single, grabs it with his dominant left hand, takes aim, and a direct hit would have taken out Bangladesh's finisher. Good work by mid-off backing up as well, could have been four overthrows
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: full on off stump - slow as well - Sabbir blocks to pick up a single at point
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: dives over the ball and it hurries away to the fine leg boundary. Look away, Chahal. Your captain's not happy. Sabbir sure is. Another expertly executed scoop shot
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: shooot! There is precious little wrong with the ball - on a length and on off stump - but Sabbir comes down the track like he owns it and launches the ball over Thakur's head. Majestic!
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: beaten by the knuckle ball outside off, and that only happens with it swinging in the air, away from the outside edge.
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: another knuckle ball, which Sabbir blocks to cover
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: this is at top pace, and it seems to deck away after pitching! Mahmudullah goes for the on the up drive, with the angled face. But he's beaten. Replays show this is a cross seamer
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mahmudullah, no run

Commentary: full toss, pushes it to long-on, and Bangladesh are getting a move on. India's quick bowlers are going to be tested in the death tonight
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mahmudullah, 1 run

Commentary: flicks it away to the left of short fine leg. Mahmudullah is such a master at manipulating fields. Time and again, he says in press conferences, that though Bangladesh doesn't have big hitters, they can take advantage of poor bowling with smart batting. He's putting it to plan here
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, FOUR runs

Commentary: absolute chaos and Mahmudullah is run-out! The only batsman to put India under pressure and his wicket has been gifted away. The action begins with a slower ball, which beats Mahmudullah. It breaks off the pitch, away from him, as he tries to flick and is hit on the pad. Sabbir is gunning for the quick single. He's halfway down the pitch, he reaches the batting crease, with Mahmudullah having taken a couple of exploratory steps before deciding there is no single. So if anyone is run out, it will be him. Karthik picks up the ball, exploits the madness by throwing it through to Shankar, who fumbles, adding to the drama. Mahmudullah starts running now, at full tilt, But the bowler is able to regain control of the ball and runs it to the stumps
Commentary_short: Shankar to Mahmudullah, OUT

Commentary: full and outside off, drives to long-off
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off, slashes it away to the third man boundary. Pretty useful outside edge there
Commentary_short: Shankar to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Shakib cuts and misses
Commentary_short: Shankar to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: shortish and cramping the left-hander, Shakib dabs it to point
Commentary_short: Shankar to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

Commentary: works the shortish delivery on middle away to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

Commentary: monsters the length ball over the wide long-on boundary. Explosive slog from Sabbir and it comes right off the middle
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX runs

Commentary: fires it full and outside off, Sabbir hits it down to long-off to bring up his fourth T20I fifty
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: backs away, but does it too early, allowing Washington to follow him. Cramps the batsman as he cuts straight to the point fielder
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

Commentary: too quick, too close to the body, and Shakib can only flick it along the ground to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off, drills it to long-on
Commentary_short: Washington Sundar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: soars into the stands at deep midwicket! Sabbir picks the slower ball, clears his front leg and slogs it with considerable power
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX runs

Commentary: goes full, goes straight, goes full pace and that gives him the desired result. A yorker that becomes a dot
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: sails over long-on! Shankar goes back to the back-of-the-hand slower ball. It comes out a juicy full toss. Sabbir stands still, summoning all his power, and then wallops it away with absolute disdain!
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, SIX runs

Commentary: looks for a scoop - so he's premeditating - and the full toss outside off - the same ball he hit for a six the last ball - pings off the bat, onto his helmet and over to midwicket
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off, spears it to cover, looks for the quick single, but has he run himself out in the process? Yep. Shankar does well to gather a fierce throw near his ankles and then knock over the stumps before Shakib can reach safety
Commentary_short: Shankar to Shakib Al Hasan, OUT
Dismissal_text: Shakib Al Hasan run out (Rahul/Shankar) 7 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 100.00

Commentary: full and outside off, steers it to sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Shankar to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: full on leg stump, Sabbir works it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, Mehidy steers it to point and Sabbir pinches the single, though there was considerable risk. He knows he needs to face the most deliveries in this partnership
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

Commentary: run-out chance! And though India muck that up, they are reviewing a lbw call made against them. Good ball from Thakur, yorker length, having Sabbir play around his front pad. Replays suggest it should be going down leg. No bat there either. Now after that, Sabbir is tempted to look for a single thanks to his partner taking a few steps down the pitch.The ball is still five feet away from the stumps at the batsman's end. Thakur spots the opportunity, gets to it, goes underarm and misses his target
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, no run

Commentary: beautiful cricket! Third man is up. The ball is short and outside off. All it needs is direction and Sabbir gives it with the angled bat. Splendid work under pressure
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: fine leg is up and he exploits that too. Sabbir is playing a blinder! He plants the bat down in line with the knuckle ball, repurposes it to become a ramp and it just sails over Chahal inside the circle
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, FOUR runs

Commentary: short and outside off, pulls it to deep midwicket
Commentary_short: Thakur to Sabbir Rahman, 1 run

Commentary: goes for the ramp over fine leg, but is struck on the pad. Unadkat goes for an appeal for lbw, but Sabbir had moved outside the line of off stump. Oh, but wait, India are reviewing this too. And they will lose it because there is a pretty big inside edge in action here.
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, 2 runs

Commentary: knocks him over! And Unadkat screams in triumph (nowhere near the batsman, so no demerits). This is a slower ball and it will be filed under the age old 'you miss I hit' tactic bowlers regale their grandchildren with over a roaring fire and some marshmallows.
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Sabbir Rahman, OUT

Commentary: bangs it into the middle of the deck and it gains way too much height. Called wide
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Rubel Hossain, 1 wide

Commentary: middle stump takes a beating and it's another slower ball, perfectly in line with the target, and the batsman generously plays all around it. Can't expect much more than a slog from a No. 9
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Rubel Hossain, OUT

Commentary: full and outside off, jams the bat down on it and sends it to mid-off
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

Commentary: perfectly executed off-drive, but it finds Dhawan and becomes no runs.
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

Commentary: slower ball outside off, Mustafizur blocks it to cover. Two wickets in the over, which ends with a hat-trick of dot balls. Unadkat hits back in staaaaayyyyyle.
Commentary_short: Unadkat to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

Commentary: scoops the length ball outside off to the long leg boundary. That shot is always going to be on with fine leg inside the circle. Or even if not, considering the way slog-overs batting has changed
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

Commentary: races down the pitch and gets a full toss above his waist to deal with.... and deals with it with a monster six over deep midwicket. What a strike! Mehidy is asking for a no-ball, but he doesn't get it because he is so far down the pitch and the ball is on its way down
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, SIX runs

Commentary: toe-ends a wide yorker out to point. Good bowling from Thakur, going full and wide
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

Commentary: slices it away to the third man boundary! These are useful runs! And it comes off the knuckle ball, with Mehidy clearing his front leg and carving it between point and third man
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

Commentary: comes down the pitch and lashes it to sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Mehidy slaps it to long-off
Commentary_short: Thakur to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs

Commentary: clips a full delivery on off stump through midwicket
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: slants the fuller delivery into the right-hander, who is waiting to let the ball pitch and turn. But it doesn't and Rohit gets an inside edge as he hurries to defend his stumps
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

Commentary: launches it to the long-on boundary, coming down the track to take on Bangladesh's best bowler. Looks a decent idea for the right-hander to play Shakib as an inswing bowler
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, FOUR runs

Commentary: fires it in on middle, Rohit works it through midwicket
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: gets down the track for a nudge to short fine leg. Rohit wants the single, it's his call since it goes behind the wicket, and Dhawan trusts it
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: full and fast on off stump, Rohit drives to extra cover
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, Dhawan blocks to cover point
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, no run

Commentary: shapes to sweep, but the line is too constricting, so he has to knock it down by the pitch and hope Rohit is up for the quick single. And yes, he is
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: overpitched and Rohit mauls it over long-on! That big back lift coming through the line of the ball and then ending up  behind his shoulders... Breathtaking shot....
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, SIX runs

Commentary: spears it down leg - and it's short too - Rohit says thank you very much with a pull shot that flies past square leg's left
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, FOUR runs

Commentary: that's pulverised! It's into the stands. It's the longest hit of the match! Rohit just jumps out of his crease, takes on a length ball and launches it over deep midwicket #LikeABoss.
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, SIX runs

Commentary: full on off stump, Rohit blocks it down the pitch
Commentary_short: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

Commentary: it's the other opener's turn, with the ball spinning into him, well, that's being generous when the ball is a long hop and it's begging for the pull shot. Dhawan doesn't disappoint
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, SIX runs

Commentary: full and outside off, works it to mid-on
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, 1 run

Commentary: turns a full delivery on leg stump to square leg
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: taken at mid-on! Excellent effort from the sub-fielder Ariful, running forward and to his right to cling on to a leading edge. Good on Shakib too, holding this ball back even though he is under attack. Dhawan comes down the pitch, looking to flick it in the air over midwicket. But his timing is all whack thanks to Shakib's genius
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Dhawan, OUT
Dismissal_text: S Dhawan c sub (Ariful Haque) b Shakib Al Hasan 10 (7b 0x4 1x6) SR: 142.85

Commentary: cuts a short ball over to point, Rohit looks for a single, but Suresh Raina, the new batsman screams no, and he's right to do so
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, drives to extra cover
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

Commentary: back of a length on Raina's pads, he turns it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Raina, no run

Commentary: hurtles down the track for a slog, but he's beaten on the inside edge. Good stuff from Rubel, beating Raina for pace
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Raina, no run

Commentary: caught behind down leg but the umpire signals wide. Mushfiqur is adamant. He wants a review. And Bangladesh taken it. It's a short ball down leg. Raina shuffles inside the line and gets an inside edge on the pull shot through to the keeper, who moves to his right and takes a regulation catch. India are two down early, in a big chase, in a final
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Raina, OUT
Dismissal_text: SK Raina c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

Commentary: blocks the good length delivery looking for the top of off stump
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, no run

Commentary: carves it up and over to the point boundary. Only one bounce before it hits the ropes. All the fielders are inside the circle on the off side, so when he sees the short and wide delivery, he has no reason to hold back
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, FOUR runs

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, clips it to the left of midwicket, where a clear single opportunity exists. But Rohit screams 'no no no no'. Just before screaming a fifth no, he realises there are runs there and accepts Rahul's call
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: pushes it to mid-on for a quick single. Easily taken
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: a little bit of turn as Rohit comes down to block a good length ball on off stump. Outside edge goes to short third man
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, no run

Commentary: mid-off is up and so Rohit dances down the track, gets inside the line of the ball and consciously opens the face of the bat to get it over that fielder. Good cricket.
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, FOUR runs

Commentary: he gets such height on his sixes! Clears his front leg and goes after the ball with roughly the same fervour as Liam Neeson goes after the bad guys in the Taken movies. Sensational hit over long-off
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, SIX runs

Commentary: full and outside off, drives to cover point
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, no run

Commentary: on leg stump, works it away to square leg, and then punches the air as if he's missed out
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, no run

Commentary: back of a length on off stump, from around the wicket, Rahul taps it down by his feet and pinches a single
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: and now he shows off the other side of his game: the one where he knows the gaps on the ground with inch-perfect precision. Brings out the late cut because the ball is short and wide and places it between third man and point. There is absolutely no power in the shot, just class
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, FOUR runs

Commentary: this is the cutter, and there is enough in the surface to provide a little bit of extra bounce. Rohit goes for that late cut again, the ball going to the left of third man. The batsman searches for a single, he's sent back, and is safe only because of a lack of direct hit
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, drives handsomely through to the left of sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 2 runs

Commentary: full on off stump, smacks it to short cover
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, no run

Commentary: shortish on middle, turns it to deep midwicket and retains strike
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: shortish and outside off, Rohit short-arm pulls it to long-on
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: hammers it over deep midwicket. India are pushing ahead of the asking rate, although they are being helped out with the bowlers missing their lengths. This is too short.
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Rahul, SIX runs

Commentary: shimmies down the pitch, searching for the ball, which simply goes on with the angle from around the wicket, takes the inside edge and goes to square leg
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off, slices it to the left of deep point. That bat was a blur as he whirled it around
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 2 runs

Commentary: squares him up with a slower delivery, angled into leg stump and the fact it is only 83 kph means it can grip the pitch and turn. With it being full as well, it troubles the batsman
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, no run

Commentary: pats a shortish delivery to long-on
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: low full toss, which Rohit hits to midwicket
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

Commentary: drives on the up and benefits from a misfield at cover by Liton Das
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: punches the short delivery to the left of point. He's found his timing straight away in this innings. So far, without looking to over-hit, he's maintaining a strike-rate of 200
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, 2 runs

Commentary: full and outside off, blocks to point and demands a quick single. It's risky. Rohit is in trouble as Mehidy dives to his right and gets up, taking aim at the stumps. Rohit has given up, and the throw goes wide!
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: back of a length and outside off, Rohit wafts at it, stuck on his back foot, and is beaten
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, no run

Commentary: slashes it to the man at deep point, who ends up being surprised at the pace at which the ball reaches him. Rohit is hittin em close to perfect.
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: full on middle, Rohit blocks to cover
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, no run

Commentary: nudges a full delivery on off stump to long-on
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: skews it.... and it lands safe! There is little need for shots like these, a down the track heave against the turn. He's not to the pitch of the ball, it turns away, catches his leading edge and somehow manages to beat cover
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: sets up for a big shot, that backlift going high, but he seems content in flicking down to long-on
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: cuts off the stumps, and manages to place it well enough to beat the man in the deep too. Special shot from Rahul, moving his feet quickly, making the room he needs to power it away
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Rahul, FOUR runs

Commentary: looks for a scoop, but the ball is too full for such shenanigans. India do get a wide though
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 wide

Commentary: stays back with the bowler going flat and quick. Flicks a single to long-on
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: glides the shortish delivery outside off behind point
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, 1 run

Commentary: runs the shortish delivery to deep point
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: top-edges the pull and it lands safely in the hands of deep square leg. Poor cricket from Rahul. This partnership had Bangladesh on the mat and he slides open the door to let them see the light. A short ball, outside off, getting too big for him to yank over to the leg side becomes his undoing.
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Rahul, OUT
Dismissal_text: KL Rahul c Sabbir Rahman b Rubel Hossain 24 (14b 2x4 1x6) SR: 171.42

Commentary: pulls a short and wide delivery down to mid-on
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Pandey, no run

Commentary: full and angled in at off stump, Pandey blocks to cover
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Pandey, no run

Commentary: works a short ball on off stump away to deep square leg. Good hustle from the fielder Sabbir, keeping it to one
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off, he drives to the sweeper cover
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: goes for the late cut, even when the ball is very very full, and barely wide of off stump. Somehow manages to get bat to it for a single to third man
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: slows it down to the new batsman, tossing the ball up. Pandey drives to cover
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Pandey, no run

Commentary: strides out of his crease, but Shakib's drift into the right-hander forces the inside edge even as Pandey looks for the drive through cover
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Pandey, no run

Commentary: flatter and quicker on middle, Pandey turns it to midwicket
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Pandey, no run

Commentary: short ball, which doesn't really come on, and Pandey awkwardly inside edges a swipe to midwicket. Beautiful over from Shakib, replete with all that makes him a great bowler. Changes of pace, trajectory and line - and all of them were impossibly subtle
Commentary_short: Shakib Al Hasan to Pandey, no run

Commentary: gets fifty and brings Colombo to its feet! A simple flick through midwicket does the job
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: comes down the pitch but doesn't get to the ball, so he makes sure to drive along the ground to deep cover. Good bowling from Nazmul, slowing it right down, giving nothing for the new man to work with
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: full on leg stump, works it to long-on
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: smacks a full and wide delivery to long-off
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: very full on middle, and Rohit digs it out from the blockhole to extra cover
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, no run

Commentary: fierce straight drive, and good on Nazmul to bend down and thrust his hands at a ball which might well have been singeing the turf as it left Rohit's bat
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: scoops the full delivery from around the wicket to the right of cover
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 2 runs

Commentary: comes down the pitch and dabs the length ball, meant to cramp him, through point
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: lifts a full delivery outside off to long-on
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: punches the back of a length delivery to extra cover
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 1 run

Commentary: slower short ball, completely messes with Pandey's bat swing as he inside edges the pull to square leg
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, no run

Commentary: slaps it to extra cover - straight to Liton Das - and runs! There is no way he is making his ground. He's not even in the frame when the throw comes.... and goes just wide of the stumps. Mustafizur was right beside it, why wasn't he backing up?
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: steps out of his crease and drives the full one on leg stump to long-on
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: taken at long-on! Rohit's gone and Bangladesh have pulled ahead in this final! India's captain has been timing them like a dream all night. But this time, going for a slog sweep at a ball that doesn't really give him enough room, he skews it high rather than long
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, OUT
Dismissal_text: RG Sharma c Mahmudullah b Nazmul Islam 56 (42b 4x4 3x6) SR: 133.33

Commentary: shortish on off stump, pushes it down to long-on. That's Vijay Shankar's first ball in T20Is. What a time to face it...
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Shankar, 1 run

Commentary: chips it to long-off.
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: gets down on one knee and finds the boundary behind square leg. Massive whippage of the wrists! That's the first four for India since the ninth over
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Shankar, FOUR runs

Commentary: full on middle, drives to extra cover
Commentary_short: Nazmul Islam to Shankar, no run

Commentary: slower ball on leg stump, he flicks it only as far as short fine leg
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: it's on a length on middle stump, Vijay Shankar lets it come on and whips it to the right of deep square leg
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, 1 run

Commentary: outside edge wanders over third man to bring up Pandey's first boundary of the night. It's full and wide, he looks to smear it over cover, but will take the result anyway
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, FOUR runs

Commentary: comes down the track and heaves it to the long-on boundary. Much more power in this shot and it beats the fielder who has only a few yards to move to his left
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, FOUR runs

Commentary: slower ball outside off, he is beaten by the lack of pace as he outside edges to short third man
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: yorker on off stump, Shankar can only keep it out
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, no run

Commentary: carves the short ball outside off out to deep point and Mushfiqur is yelling himself hoarse as the fielder gives up two
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, 2 runs

Commentary: full and outside off, Pandey slogs to long-on
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: full and outside off - it's the cutter - and Shankar's loft over cover just doesn't come off. There's a slip in as well from Shakib. Good captaincy
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, no run

Commentary: another cutter, and Shankar has no clue. Looks to swipe it over midwicket, and ends up getting hit on the body.
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, 1 leg bye

Commentary: full toss, outside off, Pandey smears it to the point boundary, well to the left of the deep point fielder. Looks like he's finally getting his timing right
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, FOUR runs

Commentary: huge appeal from the wicketkeeper as Pandey slogs and misses a cutter angled across him
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, no run

Commentary: pumps it down to long-off
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, 1 run

Commentary: yorker on middle, Pandey slices it to deep point and races back for the second as well. The throw is flat but it's just wide enough that in the time Mushfiqur takes to guide it onto the stumps, Pandey is safe
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, 2 runs

Commentary: in the slot outside off, but Pandey skews it out to long-on, along the ground, mistiming it
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, 1 run

Commentary: hammers it to the left of deep midwicket and Vijay Shankar finds the boundary India desperately need. He couldn't pick up Mustafizur's slower balls, but the part-timer Sarkar's are a much easier job
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, FOUR runs

Commentary: yorker on middle, Vijay digs it out and looks for a single. It's very risky, Sarkar only needs to go a couple of steps to his right to collect it. The throw is underarmed. Vijay gives up. But the ball misses target
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, 1 run

Commentary: run-out chance at the stirkers' end, after Pandey drills the yorker back down the pitch and looks for a single again. Sarkar collects the ball, hurls it at the stumps and breaks em perfectly. Replays however indicate Pandey got his bat down in time
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Pandey, no run

Commentary: swings wildly and the back of a length ball outside off goes away unpunished
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, no run

Commentary: good length ball outside off, Shankar looks to punch it through the covers, but the offcut beats him again. Outrageous skill from Mustafizur
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, it grips in the pitch and darts sharply past Shankar's swishing bat. He's not happy it's not been called a wide
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, goes for the slice behind point, and is again beaten. Four balls, each time beaten. Mustafizur is on the cusp of bowling a maiden in the 18th over a final! What a talent!
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, no run

Commentary: strikes him on the body as he shuffles across and looks to swing it over the leg side.  Pandey gets his partner through for a leg bye
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Shankar, 1 leg bye

Commentary: taken at long-on! What an over from Mustafizur! He's the game-breaker! Continues bowling full and wide outside off. Pandey does manage to get bat to it, but his slog has no timing. Wicket maiden from Mustafizur in the 18th over
Commentary_short: Mustafizur Rahman to Pandey, OUT
Dismissal_text: MK Pandey c Sabbir Rahman b Mustafizur Rahman 28 (27b 3x4 0x6) SR: 103.70

Commentary: low full toss and DK pummels it over long-on! Comes in, sets himself up, standing outside his crease, and lifts the ball straight over Rubel's head. This T20 is see-sawing all over the place!
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, SIX runs

Commentary: heaves it to the right of long-on! And Colombo goes beserk! DK gets his back leg outside off, sets up a strong base, and slogs the half-volley away to the boundary. Rubel's yorker goes wrong and India's hopes rise up
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, FOUR runs

Commentary: and it's outta here again! DK is in #BossMode. This is the six Mahmudullah hit to bring Bangladesh into the final and now he watches it from the opposition camp as a full delivery on leg stump is heaved over square leg.
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, SIX runs

Commentary: slower ball outside off, DK looks to cut, but he misses it. Mushfiqur goes for the appeal, but there is plenty of distance between bat and ball
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, no run

Commentary: comes down the track and hammers the back of a length delivery to long-off
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, 2 runs

Commentary: scoops it to the long leg boundary! What an innings! Rubel is one of Bangladesh's bankable bowlers because of the pace he generates. But here all of that pace has worked in India's favour. Like here, with fine leg up, DK brings that shot into play by first moving way down leg to draw the bowler outside off, then gets in position, down on one kneeand sends it soaring away into the night sky
Commentary_short: Rubel Hossain to Karthik, FOUR runs

Commentary: full toss down leg, Vijay Shankar can't get bat to it, he can't get a bye either -might have been run-out if Mushfiqur had hit - but the umpire does his job and calls a wide.
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, 1 wide

Commentary: length ball, perfectly set up for the smash down the ground, but Vijay Shankar is unable to put bat to ball.
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, no run

Commentary: full and outside off, drives to extra cover for a single
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, 1 run

Commentary: yorker outside off, DK skews it out to deep point and it's only a single
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Karthik, 1 run

Commentary: picks the gap at third man! It's a very full ball outside off, and that tiny bit of room is just what he needs to plant the open face down on it and send the ball between point and third man
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, FOUR runs

Commentary: taken, it's taken, Bangladesh have a wicket, and it comes despite one man dropping the catch. Long-on runs in to get under the ball. He gets both hands to it but the ball pops out. Luckily, Mehidy has also come running in from long-off and he takes the rebound beautifully.
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Shankar, OUT
Dismissal_text: V Shankar c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Soumya Sarkar 17 (19b 3x4 0x6) SR: 89.47

Commentary: flat! hard! AND HE'S CLEARED THE BOUNDARY! INDIA WIN! And the dressing room goes mad! Sarkar is hunched over on the ground! What an innings. DK is lost in the huddle. He has all of his team-mates climbing all over him. He's floored, after he has floored Soumya Sarkar over the cover boundary with incredible style!
Commentary_short: Soumya Sarkar to Karthik, SIX runs
